poem:
**Sanctions**

Dmitri spins tales
on Channel One 
while the city frets—
a million dollars,
a car with shadowed glass,
a suit stitched 
with whispers of laundered cash.

Beyond screens,
a world tilts 
under the weight 
of hidden gold—
a flat, 
a stipend, 
dreams folded into silence.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russian TV presenter charged with violating US sanctions and money laundering US investigators have indicted a prominent Russian state television personality and his wife for violating sanctions and money laundering as the White House targets Kremlin influence operations ahead of the US presidential elections. Dimitri Simes, a television presenter and producer for Russia’s state-owned Channel One, was charged with receiving over $1m (£759,000) in compensation, a personal car and driver, a stipend for a flat". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
